creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: scenes along the shoreline of the Sumida River, with the vantage point looking from the river; houses and buildings with people being active in the streets, with occasional red temple buildings; view is occasionally obscured by large bridge pylons and supports; continuous cloud of haze over much of upper scene; storm near end
medium: Ink and color printed on paper
signed: signed and dated at end: [Selected by Toko Genrin, painted by Tsuruoka Rosui, and engraved by Sekine Kaei in the fifth day of the fifth month of 1781]
title: Both Banks of the Sumida River
